description: It lives up to the hype.  The environment rocks, they have Guinness on tap, and the scene from the second floor is awesome.  A great place to drink and dream.
author: Rego S.

description:
my date and i only ordered seltzers with lime, but they didn't seem to care. (you know how some bars behave when you try to order a -- GASP -- nonalcoholic beverage!).  

anyway, vesuvio is pretty much 100 percent ADORBS. so cozy and quaint and cool all around. you can just imagine all the amazing poets and writers and wannabe kerouacs hanging the shit out of the place back in the day. nice balcony/2nd level seating, too. it was crowded on a monday night, too, which made me feel less weird about being "out" on a weeknight. loved it.
author: Elle B.

description: My story goes like this. It was my friend's birthday. When we walked in she was seated in a funky rattan outdoor throne of sorts and we gathered around her with our beers, laughing and happy to be in her 'queendom' at Vesuvios. We had a great time because it's so mellow, non-yuppie, and fun.
author: Jessica D.

description: What's a bar doing on a tea list? Well, they have quite the selection of gourmet fancy teas. Went here once for happy hour with my then-pregnant wife. She timidly ordered a tea but wasn't scoffed at, instead they brought her a box of at least a dozen herbal and fine teas to choose from. North Beach at its best!
author: Brandon R.

description: Once you're done checking out the clubs and pseudo-clubs in North Beach, head over to Vesuvio's for a pint.  It's rustic, old-worldly, and quaint.  If you can score a seat upstairs and in the back by the window, you can get a great view of Columbus and people walking the streets.
author: Akshay S.

description: Visiting friends in San Francisco, down from Seattle, I totally felt at home here - like Cap Hill. Sitting upstairs, the ambience was good. Strong drinks, friendly bar staff, diverse and fun crowd
author: Jeff W.

description:
im probably only giving this 3 stars because my friends are funny and i always have a good time with them.

other than that vesuvio, i would only come here if i was with a very small group of people like max 3. i mean i myself was only with like 7 other people and we squished (twice) into these booths.

the waitress seemed super stressed and annoyed with us but its like beezietron get over it, youre a waitress. we're trying to help you actually. but they have all these beers and i wish i could have tried them all but i did not.

the setting is really cool. totally laid back. the upstairs is nice. its not really a stuffy bar. i mean hey, air circulation is nice so i guess 3 stars is deserved.

oh ps. watch out for the couple practically have sex on the booth upstairs in the back. yikes.
author: A. V.

description: This place is such a cliche. Wooded walls, high ceilings, cramped conditions -  young, old, hippie, beatnik, regular people talking drinking, laughing, looking. Sixties pictures of James Joyce, Jack K besides people in thrift-store jackets, bent over pad and paper scribbling for the next generation, inspired by the kitch of genius gone by.  Quaint sixties mingles with quaint victoriana - scandalous gas-lamp projection show every 45 minutes (?) with gentlemen in straw boaters canoodling with ladies showing way too much ankle. Yes, this place is such a cliche and never forced - there is something here that makes you want to write better - or at least read better.
author: Kingpin X.

description:
This is my favorite bar in SF.  I love it!  GREAT DRINKS! GREAT PEOPLE! Awesome Bartenders!  I always try and sit upstair and in the 'John Wilkes' Booth if I'm with a crowd...  But upstairs is nice even if you alone so you can watch the hustle and bustle as night falls and the crowd thickens. It can get crowded with annoying tourist during peak seasons due to all the Beatnik history this bar holds and I find it highly amusing. This place screams 'On The Road' and if you were anything like me in high school... you had you're On The Road phase and worshipped the ground Kerouac walked on and wrote about then I suggest you visit the very bar he got sloshed at every night!  Everytime I'm there I get some arsty farsty tourist to come in and say... "Is this really the place Jack Kerouac drank?" 
This place is unassuming... and is great to get away from the terrible night clubs springing up on Broadway and Columbus. It's a taste of true SF!
author: Lacey C.

description: this is my favorite bar in all of San Francisco. the atmosphere is totally cool, with echoes of North Beach Beatniks lingering in the corners.  The only downside is that it can get crowded with tourists.   Vesuvio's is open every day from 6 in the morning til 2 in the morning, so you know its good.
author: Jon F.

description:
this place doesn't seem to fit with the rest of north beach.  i mean, north beach is a different vibe than the rest of the city.  and, without meaning to offend, my roommate a few years ago recommended avoiding it because of chaches and hooches.  she was right.

but vesuvio seems to avoid these types, thankfully.

great atmosphere.  i love the balcony.  good selection of beers on tap.  great people watching if you sit in the front and look out onto the street.  i really liked the vibe of this place.   i was there on a monday night, so the crowd was kind of ecclectic.  a few hipsters, a few chaches, and some dirty old men looking to score with a drunk girl.

of course.

but the place is pretty chill.  nice place to meet friends and talk.  and good selection of music playing, too.
author: Kimberly K.

description: Still a great place to get a drink in North Beach.  The last time I was there, the place was deserted, it was a Tuesday, the Anchor Steam was cold, the Maker's Mark was warm and the Robin Williams movie 'What Dreams May Come' was playing on the TV.  If that doesn't scream 'CLASSIC SAN FRANCISCO BAR' I don't know what does.
author: Mike O.

description: This is my new favorite bar. I really truely love everything about this bar. Except the space. You really cant bring a large group of people here and the beer selection is a bit on the weak side. Hence the missing star. But really, other than that this place is downright dynamite. It gives off so many vibes it's almost bipolar. There arent many bars designed like Vesuvio's and i like it like that.
author: Tedi O.

description: So I was leaving Maggie McGarry's bothered by the experience and happened upon Vesuvio. I love finding places this way. At first, I as taken by how every square inch of this place is covered by memorabilia. Ordered two Anchor Steams from the ancient bartender and took a look around. Did not go upstairs which was quite "couply." The men's bathroom is basically the basement - take care walking  up those ancient stairs. Would come back and recommend to visitors.
author: Michael H.

description: The drink was a bit weak, the owner was kind of nazi about checking my ID but the ambience is positive and the location prime.
author: regina k.

description: I've walked by this bar tons of times, but it wasn't until tonight that I had the chance. I walked into the bar and found it to be narrow and cramped in a twisted North Beach way that may have been designed to allow for maximum boob grabbing or what not. I sat upstairs and hung out watching the diverse crowd of people half tourists and half locals. It's in such a busy part of town that it is really easy to get sidetracked by all the North Beach strip clubs' flashing lights.
author: Laura G.

description: I've been going to this bar for many a year and it's about time i write something. This is a solid place of much history on the walls, beautiful art work on the tables and new shows each month. The staff couldn't be any better. Intent and funny with smart sexy appeal. Great place to write in the corner upstairs over looking the north beach street and citylights books Or to strike up a conversation with someone new travelers and locals alike always friendly.
author: Don j. c.

description: San Francisco has plenty of bars to choose from. It's an alcoholic's paradise. However, only few were watering holes to the great Beat authors, specifically Jack Kerouac who drank himself to death--literally. The history of this place alone is a reason to try it. But, aside from that, the atmosphere is awesome and the drinks are tasty. What more can you ask for?
author: Lauren C.

description:
Yeah, mannnn - Dig it. . .*snaps fingers* Was about to grab my bongos, black turtleneck, and beret when the old man suggested that we check out one of Jack Kerouac's hangouts, Vesuvio. Umm, don't do that idiot, we're not in the 60's anymore.  I really thought I'd see some hipsters hanging out - yeah, there were some. But, most of the patrons were just regular ol' folks.
This place is packed to the gills with kitsch! Feeling a bit claustrophobic, I couldn't sit downstairs much longer, so we teetered up that twisted, narrow staircase to the second floor where there is a little more breathing room - yeah, just a little. Copped a squat next to the window with a nice view of Kerouac Alley, sipped on my coffee from the pretty glass, visited the teeny-tiny funky bathroom, and skedaddled outta there . . . rather, teetered back down the precarious stairs.  Nice place to visit, but I wouldn't make it a regular hang out; there are plenty of other places in North Beach - Hmmm . . . did Hemingway booze it up at any nearby watering holes?
author: Kara B.

description: I'm one of those people that will take a book to the bar, order a drink, and just sit by myself reading. With it's close proximity to Citylights and bright lighting, Vesuvio provides the perfect atmosphere to do that. The upstairs window seats also provide a great place to people watch all those walking up and down Columbus.  Decently priced drinks and a nice atmosphere.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I've only been to this place once and can't say I remember all the details very well, but I really liked it. Aside from sitting on barrels, I can't really explain why I liked it so much, I just did. go.
author: Ali L.

description: Just a cool place to grab a drink! Downstairs at the bar is a good place to situate yourself if you quickly want a drink every time you finish one, but I'm partial to the upstairs. Lots of different places to sit where you can either look down on the first level and watch the people and the stills being projected onto screens or you can sit by the windows and watch the people stroll by. Either way...always a stop for me when I'm in North Beach. Quaint and just a great place to enjoy a nice cold one...be it a beer or a cocktail!
author: Dina L.

description: Awesome. I haven't been in Vesuvios for about 10 years (living way North now) but it reminds me of much of what I miss from the Bay Area.
author: Don B.

description:
this is an odd little place. the walls are adorned with so many pictures it feels like buca di beppo, and the bathrooms have ceilings that require you to duck down if you're more than 6 feet tall. the stained-glass windows give it a somewhat 'churchy' feel.

i saw someone paying by credit card and signing the receipt, so of course i bust out the plastic and try to order the next round. then, the bartender [who looks like a mix between curly from 'city slickers' and dr. brown from 'back to the future'] then refuses to take my credit card, demanding cash. what the hell?

it's dirty, and it's incredibly weird. again, having fun at this place is completely dependent on who you're with.
author: Charles C.

description: Quaint little dive bar to chill out over pitchers of beer.  It can be quite crowded on a friday night though.
author: Jeff H.

description: Awesome.  I really enjoyed this place.  My best friend and I stopped here on a Monday afternoon after trekking up and down Columbus and buying some books next door. This place has a very cool vibe, with lots of tables to sit at and chat with your friends or read.  The waitress was really good about checking in on us and getting us another round when we finished our first one.  Collectively we had 1 glass of wine and 3 cocktails.  The wine came in a cute (aka small) wine glass, but the cocktails were delicious.  All in all nothing to complain about b/c our 4 drinks totaled to $21.00.  Good drinks that are easy on my broke ass college student wallet?  You win.
author: Ellen S.

description: Our favorite North Beach bar.  Eclectic, lots to look at, pretend that your a poet back in the day and this was your hangout.
author: Dianne M.

description: I'm a sucker for places steeped in history and, oddly enough, upstairs window seats, so, it's no surprise I love Vesuvio.
author: Chadwick M.

description:
a great drinking bar that opens at 6 am!!!

very UN-pretentious with stiff drinks and the tenders' personalities complient the ecclectic interior.

nestle in at a table or step up to the bar and try to relive kerouac's thoughts. dont forget the madame's table upstairs.
author: Inga R.

description: Went up to the City with my wife for a weekend getaway, and was surprised to see that they have an Absinthe water dispenser on the bar - I forgot the Green Fairy was now legal again. If you're going to drink it, you might as well be in a bohemian joint like Vesuvio...
author: Steve A.

description: Its fun little place to have a drink. Staff was friendly and service was good. Its a bit of a dive, but that is a positive thing IMHO. All in all a great bar.
author: Sean D.

description: This is one of my all-time favorite bars. As a big fan of the Beat Generation, it's cool to drink and pee where Kerouac and his cohorts did. Even if it weren't an old beat haunt, I would still come here. It's a very comfortable bar in a great location.
author: Dan F.

description: North Beach classic, right on jack kerouac alley. Sit on the second floor table (for 2) facing Columbus and watch San Francisco move. Highly recommended.
author: Sav B.

description: I like Vesuvio. The bartenders and staff have always been nice to me, no matter how crowded or not the place is. The drinks are basic and not overpriced. I love the decor and the stained glass and goofy rattan chair. Sitting upstairs provides a bird's eye view of the sometimes chaotic activity on Columbus. I don't feel like Vesuvio is overly touristy, but probably because I rarely go with tourists. It also helps that it is right across the street from my office making it a logical choice for happy hour.
author: Allyson V.

description: It's San Francisco. I always take first-time S.F. visitors to this spot. Undoubtedly a good time, even when it's packed to the rafters and it's less than locals.
author: Chris S.

description: Ugh.  Stun-gun me please so that I can tolerate cattle-pens like this for unimaginative tourists.  I had tried to go across the street to Tosca but it was closed on a Monday night so we settled into Vesuvio for a nightcap.  Between the creepy bartender staring at us for long periods of time (too much LSD, brother), the bad jukebox (disco?  really?), and painted (or nailed) on the wall atmosphere, it just wasn't doing it for us.  Dunno, maybe we caight it on a bad night, but it just felt like an older version of a shitty TGI Friday's.  There are better airport bars than this.
author: Jon M.

description: We just got back from drinks with friends from Vesuvio's and it was a nice evening.  The place is not a tourist trap even though it's in a sort of touristy neighborhood.  I like the casual atmosphere.  People are very down to earth and nice too.  It was busy when we arrived around 11, but I imagine getting there earlier it wouldn't be so bad.  Try it on a weekday.  No crowds.
author: Jin W.

description: Every time I'm in San Francisco I visit this bar. If I lived in SF I'd be here a couple times a week. They'd have to name a table for me. It's got a great feel -- friendly, relaxed, eclectic. Second floor booth near the balcony is the best seat in the house.
author: Sara F.

description: still a fan but what happen to my pint of mai tai?  my mai tai turned into a regular glass.  it's ok.  i'm still a fan.
author: Anita C.

description: I like this place, very chill, and such a San Francisco treat, I love the feel of the place music varies which is nice it's in North Beach so it attracts tourists but there are a good bunch of locals that frequent.
author: Veggielicious V.

description: For me, if a bar doesn't have any character, it's a deal breaker and this bar definitely has character. It also has some pretty cool history, after all, Jack Kerouac was a regular there. When I saw it from the outside, I immediately knew it was going to be one of my regular SF places. I got dibbs on the Booth For Lady Psychiatrists :)
author: Tina M.

description: The location is perfect for out of town guests.  I love the upstairs seating with a view of Jack's Alley.  But, the neighborhood is just so touristy that it'd be hard to make this a regular spot.  The drinks were nothing special.
author: Caricia C.

description: When I first visited San Francisco, I came to this bar after a trip to the mecca of Beat Literature, City Lights. Vesuvios is what I imagined a San Francisco bar to be like. A loft style bar that has some intimate tables for a quieter conversation, but still allows you to look down at the bar floor area and out into the heart of North Beach. Friendly bar tenders and no nonsense wait staff add to the laid back eclectic vibe. One of my favorite bars in San Francisco and I make it a point to visit it on every trip. Tasty mixed drinks that will get you floored if your not careful.
author: m p.

description: If you're lucky enough to grab an upstairs booth or a table alongside the window, you're set.  The drinks are stiff and provide ample ammo for people watching and philosophizing in this wonderful North Beach staple.
author: Sarah S.

description: This is probably one of my favorite bars of all time.  Everyone from the doorguys, to the bartenders, to the majority of the patrons are really nice.  The atmosphere is great as well.  More importantly, the drinks are spot on.  I order Kettle One & club soda with a lime and 80% of the time at other bars I recieve a vodka tonic (which i hate) so I appreciate them getting it right here.  However, the one thing I do not fancy about this bar are their restrooms.  They are too tiny and not as clean as I would like them to be.  But other than that I absolutely adore this place!!
author: Lindsay S.

description: Chill little bar off of Colombus street. Came here a few nights ago with a few friends. Nice staff and friendly folks at the bar (except for the girl who punched my friend for no reason at all as he walked in--granted he's 6'9" and gets all sorts of reactions for his height, but that was a little ridiculous). We had the Bohemian Coffee--great, strong stuff (I could start every morning with a coffee like that!). Dude next to us at the bar started chatting us up and he was cool. Knew the small town of Buffalo where my friend was from and everything. Would definitely like to drop by again.
author: Donna W.

description: Still my favorite bar in SF.  Yeah, I'm weird like that.  I hesitate to review my favorite bar for a number of reasons.  But how can my profile be complete without it?  Why do I love Vesuvio?  I don't think I can explain it rationally.  It's more of a feeling, a vibe.  Sure it's got that beat(nik) history and probably hasn't changed much since the 50s.  Yeah, it's next door to City Lights.  Part of the wonder is that I feel as if I could write moving poetry or a wild short story sitting at a little table upstairs, and it wouldn't cost me that much.  Maybe it's the brick-a-brack.  Maybe it's the memories I have of sitting in a booth sipping wine with the woman who broke my heart.  Maybe it's the bartenders that I love, or the eclectic clientele.  I now realize that trying to explain Vesuvio is like trying to explain Paris, or tomatoes.
author: Chad W.

description: Great bar, great vibe, good selection of brews.  Sat upstairs and had a great view of the rest of the bar as well as most of the action along Columbus and Broadway.  Our waitress was cute and she only got cuter as the night passed.  I'll be returning here for sure.
author: Gary L.

description:
5 stars for decor and ambiance alone.  i've only actually had drinks here once, and we just split a pitcher, so I can't really comment on the legitimacy of the cocktails or the extent of the beer/wine list (so i'll hold off on that 5th star until i can really rate the entire package).  but in terms of a good place to start or end the night, or the afternoon really, it's much nicer than the typical north beach scene.  

you could spend hours just looking at and trying to read everything on the walls.  and the upstairs section is the perfect place to sit and chat and watch people walking by.  during the afternoon/early evening it almost feels like some berkeley coffee shop relocated to north beach as there tend to be people reading books in the upstairs booths and the crowd isn't so rowdy.  I appreciate that it's slightly off the beaten path that is the Broadway night scene.  you'll feel more hip just being inside vesuvio.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: I love sitting upstiars and watching the people walking down Columbus Ave. There are a lot of colorful characters in that neck of the woods! The drinks are reasonably priced, and I've never had a difficult time finding a table. And if all of that isn't enough for you, it's across the alley from City Lights Books and was one of Jack Kerouc's hangouts.  It's a great place to relax with friends after an afternoon of walking around the city.
author: Hallie H.

description: It's got the history, and it's a pretty cool bar to hang out in.
author: Don H.

description: I really don't care who used to drink here.  What I loved about this place is that there are tables to sit at, even on a Saturday evening, and that you could actually hear the other people in your group talk without them having to yell.   Any time I'm eating in/near North Beach, I'll head here for a drink beforehand.
author: Kristin L.

description: This is a place of poetic and literary history. For this reason, many will love it.  A few people hide in lonely corners with a notebook and a pen. Others perch themselves on a friendly bar stool to engage in matters of  importance and leisure. A few gather at the jukebox in search of music for their soul. Some just gather along the walls to marvel at it all. This place is San Francisco. After a few pints of Anchor Steam and your first step out of the bar and into the inviting chill of  Kerouac Alley comes a moment  of beautiful clarity ... this is my home!
author: Michael R.

description: Went there for drinks after work. The staff is accomodating. Good volume for table conversation. I had some sort of creamy cocktail with bailey's irish cream or something... it came in a tall thin glass. Both yummy and in a good size. The corner location and funky decor makes it easy to find, and conveniently situated in the heart of North Beach. I was told drinks can be pricey, but I can't comment since I didn't pay. Next time I'll come try the teas I hear about.
author: Clar L.

description: Hit this joint mid-week and chill out with friends. Sit upstairs and people-watch below at the bar. Try not to fall down the stairs when leaving.
author: Dave L.

description: Great character. Fun to sit in the second floor balcony area.
author: L C.

description: It's not the cheese in the tourist trap, but it is an old dead mouse lying next to it that scavengers feed on when the cheese is gone.  It has the historical element and it's old school but now that it is a classic, it draws an unappealing crowd.
author: Patrick A.

description: I'm not in the North Beach area much but got whisked away to this bar last night and had a blast. The drinks were damn good, cheap enough for me, and most importantly, the waitress cut me off. The stairs are sort of scary to walk down when you're fairly lit, but it's great to sit up there and people watch. Corner table with the alien pictures made me happy.
author: Mr. C.

description:
Kitsch, funky interior.  I don't know why places that have an upstairs balcony where you can look at the first floor are always more fun. Cozy and chill.
Only mild complaint:  when I went on a Sunday early evening, they had stopped serving espresso drinks.  The only coffee available was plain black, with sugar/equal, and cream/whole milk (so fine, I like splenda and nonfat milk in my coffee, but otherwise, i'm really not that picky :P).  No iced tea either.
Regardless, still delightful to bring friends or a date. Cute alley next to it as well.
author: Quince P.

description: Cheap drinks, good people watching, jazzy decor. And located around the corner from Hustlers.
author: Tamar N.

description: If it weren't for the history, I'd probably leave a less positive review.  It's alright for some low key boozing, but it gets so freaking crowded at times.  Since it's North Beach, there's a ton of bridge and tunnel crowd.  Wait, now that I moved out of SF, that's me.  Eh...  it's alright.
author: Scott M.

description: Good atmosphere, great location, not too expensive, and they make a damn good margarita.  I like to sit upstairs, although the service up there is occasionally iffy.  Usually have a decent mix in the background, too.
author: Marianne F.

description: Sacred ground.  A very chill bar whose staff refuses to bow down to douche-dom.  Come as you are, no pretense, and it's all good.
author: Andrea U.

description: I adore Vesuvio.  It is my kind of place for sure... relaxed atmosphere, good drinks, awesome history, lots of friends, and intimate tables.  I love that I can come here and always find something new.  The windows on the second floor allow for some amazing people watching.  I just love it here.
author: Laura B.

description: I simply love this place. Whenever I am in the city, this is one of those joints I make an effort to get to. It has all the feel of the perfect neighborhood bar. The drinks are well made and served quickly. It has charm. Not to mention the history of it all. Worth a visit by all who enjoy a good low-key bar that had been slinging drinks to thirsty masses.
author: Michael C.

description: I have always enjoyed going here.  When I lived within walking distance I went here regularly.  Usually I would start at the the San Francisco Brewing Company for bear and a burger, then head up Tel Hill to Vesuvio for cocktails.  Today I like to go here to remember old San Francisco and also bring out of town guests.  Its eclectic and different with great history to share over cocktails.  You get what you expect here.  The bartenders are hit or miss, but the drinks are usually strong, regardless.
author: Julian A.

description: I just had drinks there. But I liked the space and you're capable of having a conversation with someone there. Happy HOUR!
author: Anita C.

description: You know something, this town is full of punks and lowlifes and that's why I like it.  If you are from somewhere outside of San Francisco (and DO NOT CALL IT FRISCO GADDAMNIT!) then you will probably not like it here, so what if it is a tourist kind of place, this town is tourist heaven!!  Ever walked down Columbus on a weekend night in the summer time?  It's FULL OF TOURISTS!!  People from out of town totally love this shit.  Anyway, sorry, I get a little fired up.  Don't miss out on this institution, get yourself a little history lesson and soak up the ambience.  Head upstairs for a table and enjoy the view, have a glass of wine and chill out already. Some people are so critical, know what I mean?
author: Barbra K.

description: I'm a local.  I had never been here until last night.  It seems like it can be grouped with some of the more classic places in North Beach.   I liked the atmosphere.  It looks like a bar would if it were right next door to city lights bookstore.
author: Lindsay T.

description: I randomly wandered into Vesuvio one weekend afternoon and immediately fell in love with the place.  It's the ambiance, definitely, and the feeling of being at home the minute I walked in the door.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Jay B.

description: I went here once last year, and remember enjoying the very unique ambiance of this place. My friends took me here because supposedly it is one of the places to check out if you're in SF. I think I had one beer, and it might have been Anchor Steam, which I'm not a huge fan of, except for their summer ale. The place was very too crowded, but then it was on a Friday night. I would so go back here more often if I lived closer to here. Maybe I'll take a friend here if he or she comes to visit me. It'll allow me to try it out again and give a better review than this too.
author: Inbae L.

description:
i never know quite what to expect from vesuvio. is it going to be jam-packed? young crowd? old crowd? marina folk? artsy type? locals? tourists? all of the above?

i've seen it all. 

i have been here on a night when a party bus chose to roll through on what was clearly NOT their first stop of the evening. from what i gathered it was some sort of estrogen packed birthday or bachelorette party. frightening! 

i've been here when it's been packed, but was not bothered because the entire crowd seemed to have a pleasant mentality about them. young, old, hippie, and yuppie all mingling in perfect harmony. strange.

vesuvio's wildly unpredictable nature is made up for by a night spent there sipping on a cocktail while gazing down onto the views of columbus street.
author: Kayla K.

description: One of my top two favorite bars in the city.  There are few things better than meeting up with a group of friends to drink beers in a booth upstairs, or spend a Saturday afternoon watching the hustle and bustle of North Beach out the windows.  Every time I go in here I feel like I'm being transported back in time, like somehow a ghost of 60's past will float by the table as I pop back another Magners and kick my feet up in the window.  Few places I'd rather be with good company on a warm summer night or a rainy winter day!
author: Chrys W.

description: The prices were reasonable, the waitress was extremely attentive, and the atmosphere is great.  Not too loud that you can't hear yourself think or have a decent conversation.
author: Jenny L.

description: Cozy, dark-wood, rainy-night ambiance, and Kerouac used to drink here. One of my favorites. Three cheers for Vesuvio!
author: Jude F.

description: My favorite spot for daytime drinking, and the absolute best place in the city for getting your drink on at 6 in the morning.  Also, its a good option to do some, err, pre-gaming, if you find yourself looking for a place to go between dinner and a night of carousing at those classy North Beach nightclubs.  Oh, I hear there's some history behind this place, too--something about writers getting drunk in the fifties.  Ask the bartender, I'm sure he'll be happy to tell you.
author: Peter R.

description: YES!  Vesuvio's is the coolest.  I fell immediately in love with the bar and the balcony and the super hip bartenderette.  we bonded.  this is the kind of spot you can go and spend all day with a good book (that you grabbed from City Lights Bookstore, of course;)) and drink a few pints.  or take a date, first or 30 years strong.  go with a group of friends.  take your parents.  take your grandparents.  take your dog.  no matter what, Vesuvio's has a spirit that will never fade.
author: Tracy E.

description: I wishe we had a place like this in Chicago.  It's tiny and cozy and loaded with character.  Weeknights is when to go, when it's a convo bar.  Service is a bit slow, but if your're there to talk and people watch, it doesn't matter much.
author: Zach T.

description: My friend and I came up to SF (im from orange county, sad times for me). We ended up at this bar 2 nights in a row. the lighting was cool, drinks were cheap, and that one bartender dude was fun to talk to. Kind of an ass, but in a charming intelligent way. He said he has a rent controlled apartment there, so i should have prob made a move on him. Drinking in the same place as Jack Kerouac isnt half bad either.
author: Alison R.

description: Great bar with a Beat history (if you don't know it, read the other reviews). I love coming here after getting some books at City Lights next door with my boyfriend, sitting at one of the window tables upstairs, sipping on cocktails and watching the constant stream of people outside.
author: Jacqui M.

description: Another great SF bar. Can be somewhat of a tourist-trap, but if you visit on a week night, generally it is SF regulars. The drinks are super stiff - so watch out. :-)
author: Gina M.

description: I'm a sucker for nostalgia. I enjoyed a few libations here on the very same weekend I decided to move to SF. I just love the feel in there. Plus if you're ever meeting someone you can always wait for them at city lights books next door. I drink Manhattans at vesuvio, but they got all the other stuff as well. It's in north beach and I'm not too keen on north beach, but maybe I haven't been the right place? Anyways, I like the bar is all I'm saying and I think you will too. As usual, I recommend avoiding it on a Friday or Saturday night, but I think I'm just a dork and I need to start enjoying the standing-room only experience. Yeah right!
author: Sterling R.

description: They say that Vesuvio was to Kerouac what Harry's was to Hemingway in Paris.  I'll take Kerouac and his bar; Hemingway's gone a bit too stout.
author: Melody D.

description: When I lived in North Beach (and even when I didn't) this place was, and still is, my favorite bar in San Francisco.  It's simple and charming and historic and when you're upstairs on a super crowded night looking out onto Columbus and down onto the bar below, there's nothing better.  You can begin your night here, end it, or make it the middle.  in fact, you can even make a nice day of it and have the upstairs all to yourself.  Whatever  way you decide to go and at whatever time, you can't go wrong.
author: Hoot A.

description: This place has the original vibe of the city and is a mandatory stop when I'm there. Not sure what happened to the jukebox since last time I was there. Lots of memories of being in this place and they are all good. Soak it in.
author: Evan M.

description: Great little bar in North Beach. Definitely filled with enough nick knacks to keep you busy if your conversation or company gets boring.  I gave it an extra star because it is right next to City Lights books!!
author: Ani M.

description: After three years of stopping by after work Vesuvio held up. There's a reason it's still around.
author: Angela K.

description: I love Vesuvio. It's a chill place to kick back and relax on a weekday for happy hour, or late at night on the weekend. Grab a beer, go upstairs, and watch the North Beach excitement out the window. If you're looking for wild and crazy fun, this isn't the place for you.
author: Ava S.

description: One of my friends insisted on her birthday that we meet her here for a few drinks. I was excited because it wasn't a club, so I thought I wouldn't be getting gross and sweaty while yelling pleasantries at one another. I was wrong. Maybe I just got it during a really busy night, but, I was definately expecting it to be a little more laid back. The staff is really quick and courteous, so it definately made up for some of my displeasure. If you don't mind a super crowded place, I would suggest giving them a try. The drinks were tasty and the staff was great too. I'm just not that good with crowds.
author: Jessica R.

description: I love love love this place. It's how San Francisco used to be and how it should always be. No swanky, trendy drinks. You want a dirty martini, you'll get it with gin, most likely. And there's absinthe, of course, if you're feeling especially Bohemian. (Although I'm pretty sure it wasn't around in the Beat times.) No pretentious pricks. Just a bunch of chill people getting drunk. I've been here more than a few times and have met some really interesting people each time. I can always count on my group starting with four people and ending up with fifteen by last call. Somewhere in the balcony sits Jack Kerouac's ghost on a stool snapping his fingers in approval at all the boozing and random strangers hooking up.
author: Ivy M.

description: Fun place to go. Right next to city lights book store. If you can get up the narrow and steep stair case it is fun to go up stairs and look over the bar. Makes you feel cool being in this bar. Not necessarily a place for regulars to hang out just because the location is touristy with it's proximity to North Beach but it is fun. Go to Valley Tavern in Noe Valley for a more neighborhood bar experience.
author: julie q.

description:
Yeah this place is packed with tourists.  Every weekend especially.  But still I happened to meet some quite cool people here.  

I hate the attitude of the guy checking IDs though.  He never remembers my face even after going there like 30 times with a hole-punched Pennsylvanian license and just thinking about selling his paintings at the Bar...  

But still I like it amongst bars in North Beach.  I can't find a few more better places than here in North Beach after all...  Am I missing something?
author: T T.

description: definitely a tourist go -to. .. Reminiscent of Kerouac and Ginsberg.   A hole in the wall with history..  stop in  between the relatives wanting to site see.. the alcohol helps the tour guiding.
author: tery c.

description: If you're a fan of Kerouac, Ginsberg, or the Beat era, you must make a pilgrimage to Vesuvio,  a bar that was at the center of it all, in the heart of North Beach.
author: John M.

description: i love it here. this is where i can't wait to take friends from out of town. a comfortable place with a lot of character. for example: old gas powered lamps, a place where the beatniks would come to hang out so many years ago, the creepy black cat above the bar, the wicker throne chair, interesting art on the walls is always changing. it's become a sort of tradition for me and a comfortable nook to sit for a while with absinthe in hand.
author: kathryn s.

description: A true San Francisco institution. We all know why we come here. C'mon, Jack Kerouac hung out here. And I'm sure he ordered many red bull and vodkas, like I did.
author: Pete L.

description: This is my favorite North Beach spot, especially after a long hike up from Market. I usually just plop down with a Guinness and stare into space, waiting for Neil Cassidy's ghost to join me. SF's Beat history is plastered all over the walls and the place's coziness reminds me why many Beat writers hid in bars for hours on end.
author: Cameron M.

description: Hey there,  potential date in the future. You want to show me a good time? Then you need to take me to the best places in town. Before you rush out and hit that $$$$ search button, think carefully over your choices. Remember who we are talking about here. I'm a girl of very little needs - for me, its all about quality over quantity. You want to get my tail wagging, then take me to somewhere like Vesuvio. For a gal who rarely pounds the streets of North Beach, it has opened up new possibilities for me. It has wall hangings galore that can be muttered over. It has interesting table tops to stare at as you drink your third or fourth or fifth whiskey. The clientele are low key and look like an interesting mix from hipsters to guys who have been here since the beat movement started. The table service - a little strange in what seems to be a dive-ish bar, but hey it works. In an economy such as this, every job is important.
author: Catriona C.

description: I love this bar!! It's my favorite place in North Beach.  And the bartenders are all great.
author: AJ G.

description:
I can not love this place more, oh wait yes I can. Amazing spot, amazing drinks, great bartenders... one AWFUL cocktail server.

I have been a server for over 8 years now, It seems almost every time I come in this blonde server is there. I really have tried being nice to her, every time tipping way more than she deserves, but she really makes the experience un-pleasant and tonight was the last straw. 
 I was in Vesuvio about 30 minutes ago, 7 pm Saturday night. She never smiles and when you ask her something and say please or thank you she just goes uh-huh. I have been in with many friends and she is rude every time, men women big groups small groups I have tried everything. Why work there if you seem to hate it? We tried getting our bill and she just ignored us for almost an hour! She only comes back over when your drink is empty, our friend sat there without a drink because she didn't like hers. She never once came back over to check up and ask the courteous "is everything ok?" it takes 2 seconds to do that and it makes a world of a difference.
 I would just order at the bar and take my drink upstairs myself but I know thats rude to do to her, but I can't stand it. Its too bad, I really love this place. :( 
 Guess I'll just only sit at the bar from now on. If anyone who works there sees this, can you please do something about this? I know what its like to serve tourists or jerks or marina people, but please, smile. Just smile, get through it, and be good to your good customers!
author: Paul-a A.

description: to come and have a drink at Vesuvio you are getting a taste of old San Francisco.. starting in the 50s this is where the authors sat making it happen, i really enjoyed walking through city lights bookstore then checking out all the newspaper clipping and pictures of the people who have past through Vesuvio. this bar has kept the feel of what it may have been like years ago and is a really fun stop. i enjoyed the upstairs seating area with the low ceiling and the balcony views. good drinks, nice service, good company, good history.
author: Barbara C.

description: It's cool inside, but not a place I'd hang out at.  Too many tourists, and it's kind of expensive.
author: Phil M.

description: granted, most of the people in here at any given moment aren't even from san francisco. maybe that's a good thing, a change of pace if you will. maybe it's annoying. but who goes to north beach to experience some local flavor? tourists, that's who. oh, and strippers. this place is cool because it's sort of an eye of the storm of north beach. don't expect anything spectacular. it's just a good bar with good drinks. simple as that.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: a $5 glass of champagne! and you can't beat the friendly & spirited company that hangs out during off hours...a great local haunt
author: Steph K.

description: This has become my go-to bar when I am entertaining out of town guests.  It has such a cool vibe, I just love it.  Sitting upstairs in a window seat watching the hustle bustle below is prime people watching.
author: Rachel M.

description:
it was pretty and the ambience was great, but the service was the worst EVER. the bartender or waitress or whatever the hell she was totally ruined my san francisco moment.  
the whole time she was staring at me like i was a blank wall and, to my friend's question about what kind of wine that she could recommend her (she's not a drinker), she said, quite annoyedly, "we just have red wine." 
my friend was still nice enough to leave tip because she has manners!
what a pretentious "historical" bar! if you want to genuinely adhere to your reputation as a gathering place for all those ppl who fought for social issues, you better lose that b*tch with that ugly red lipstick who is most likely a racist.
author: t l.

description: came here already on a buzz with a friend after hoofin' around north beach, taking in nice views on steep stoops.  the seating inside is excellent.  cozy ambiance with a nice view down onto busy columbus.  service is great.  people are laid back.  bathroom is full of beer bottle labels to entertain your lenses while you release some of the day's ingestion.  i dig it, i dig it.
author: Beccie F.

description: the crowd can really bring this place down sometimes, but if you're there when Jo Anna or Abby are working, then it's Charm City!
author: steven w.

description: yes, this place has some cool SF history... diverse and laid-back crowd. i prefer sitting upstairs. next door is another great place. citylight bookstore. again, a lot history.
author: Michelle I.

description:
went to meet friends and i thought the decor/atmosphere/vibe/chi was lovely. ordered a stella, tipped, sat down to chat. but then shit went sour when i realized my beer was bitter, flat, and not right. stella is a little crisp and bitter, but this was undrinkable. i politely told the bartender the stella tasted weird, and he made some snide remark suggesting that i (a supposed beer newb in the midst of salty crusty old bachelors) just didn't know what stella tastes like. the crusty old bachelors around the bar laughed at his remark. then he poured himself a taste, made a face, and replaced my drink. too late, i already felt like an ass.

shame since i work nearby and will never come back. there are lots of places where i feel like a piece of shit, but dammit i refuse to be treated like anything less than a golden god when i step foot into a place of booze.
author: Erica C.

description: Dark, friendly bar atmosphere with balcony seating. They allow you to use the restroom if you're a City Lights bookstore refugee.
author: KD D.

description: this place is a definite on a pub crawl gathering for my friends and i.  they're not scared about serving up an order of 10 car bombs and stand by ready to dish out more!  my friends and i always have a great time here and honestly, what more can you say!
author: Swarup B.

description: my friend and i ventured to the area to meet up with some friends for a birthday celebration.  when we finally got there they had already left.  very bummed we started to walk back to the bus stop and stumbled upon Vesuvio.  its great! it was a saturday night so i may have expected it to be  a little more crowded, but the bartender informed us it was more of a locals scene on the weekdays, especially thursday.  very fun and friendly  and eccentric.
author: elizabeth r.

description: vesuvio looks pretty old and crusty, but it's unique with history and it's bohemian atmosphere. i usually go there around mid-afternoon when it's pretty much abandoned except for the 1 or 2 old timers sitting at the bar. i find it quite an experience to have a drink and to simply look around and take in the history and the feel of this place.
author: Doris Y.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!! I can only tell you that EVERY TIME I visit San Francisco I find myself here, Drinking in the wake of legends, the writing's on the wall, so to speak. Just go check it out, and find out for yourself how truly awesome it is!!!!
author: Conspiracy T.

description: tons of seating room, loads of interesting pictures and news clippings on the walls, a giant bar selection, and good music that they don't play too loud to think-- I couldn't ask for more.
author: Luthien N.

description: This bar is unique and wonderful. Get a spot at a table upstairs and stare out the window at the city and the lights. It feels as though you are sat aboard a galleon slowly sinking into Columbus Avenue. It's cozy, friendly, magical and unpretentious. It maybe my favourite bar in the world.
author: Andrew C.

description: one of the bars in my hood i would randomly find myself in on a weekend day, upstairs is great spot for people-watching... you will see the regular homeless, tourists, and occasionally sf locals walk by... if you like sports they also got a few plasma displays for that...
author: Andrew N.

description: i had a terribly bad stomach ache while we were at this bar.  probably a combination of the previous whiskey drinks, mixed in between patron and jameson's shots, and the chinese food/beer we had right down the street minutes before.  i did vomit a bit in the bathroom, just to clean out the chinese food- and after a recovery period i was back in the game.  unfortunately it was after we had left vesuvio.  but i could see myself really enjoying this place- fun crowd, good beer, good service, and great decor.  i'd like to return during my next SF visit- and this time i'll wait to have chinese food after the bar.
author: Sean L.

description: I'm a history buff so this bar, area and vibe are just plain cool.  I wouldn't wonder in here after my Wall Street suit job but anyone else would feel comfortable!
author: Misti L.

description: GREAT GREAT GREAT spot to grab a drink, or two, or three, or six, you get my point right? It's in a great location, good place to start off the night or end the night, I've done both. I'm a fan of poshy places, but there is nothing like a good old bar full of history and flair to spend a few hours drinking in.
author: S A.

description: I went to Vesuvio last night and loved it! It was packed even for a Wednesday night and the best part is that it is such a diverse crowd of all ages. I definitely like how this place has so much history and definitely grab a seat upstairs, you can the whole place from there (preferable the booth in the right when you hit the top of the stairs).. the ambiance is laid-back and chill, definitely going back!
author: Vivian D.

description: I went here alone one afternoon and simply sat upstairs and sipped on my beer-looking out into Kerouac alley. Its perfect for solitude or jovial beer drinking. Maybe its the history, maybe its because of its proximity to city lights book store, but you cant help but feel a little literary when you enter this amazingly outfitted bar. The interior design is enough to entertain even the most greedy eyes. I am plotting my next journey to Vesuvio's..readying my journal and my pen...
author: robyn k.

description: love this place. cluttered and dark with the buzz of sports on the downstairs tv in the background... oooh, so perfect! and to sit and look across jack kerouac alley at at city lights, thinking of the history is amazing. at one time, at one place, not long ago, it all happened right there... breathe it in.
author: Jennifer N.

description: i take my drinking seriously. i'm also an art student. the fact i got to shoot upstairs in vesuvio's and then have a beer afterwards was awesome. i have a lot of great memories here (my first drink for my 21st birthday, celebrating a great work event's success) and the bar staff is always really funny and sweet to me. color is game here, and the upstairs provides a quick escape when you need to have a heart to heart or are interested in more intimate chats. if you stand outside on the weekends too, it's great to make fun of the B&T crowd too. locals mostly drink here, and i like to drink. did i say that already?
author: Jenz y.

description: I love this place!!!  It is small and has at home feel to it.  It is a definitely old place, sometimes I just hope that an earthquake doesn't hit when I'm in there! hehehe  It's very chill, and you can go dressed anyway you like.  There are all kinds of people there and I like that!  It's comfortable!  I like how they decorated it too.  Perfect place to go hang out with your friends.  Music is not too loud so you can have a conversation!  I just love it!
author: S. L.

description: 7$ Absinthe and plenty of seating options.  The drinks are fairly priced.  Beware, entertainers may come up to your table (magicians, musicians... who knows).  If you're not into this, just thank them before they start and let them know that you're here to catch up with an old friend/ relax and read, etc.
author: pauline e.

description: Landmark San Francisco establishment and home to Beats, yes the Beat generation.  Fantastic historical bar with a great atmosphere and lots of history.  A must for anyone who live in San Francisco or is just visiting.
author: Administrative C.

description: this spot is always a good time, often time spells trouble for the night.  however, the one problem is that it is often really hot in the bar, like the type of hot that you break out in a sweat when you walk in.  just don't stay for too long or you might start to fall asleep from the combo of alcohol and heat.
author: Tim G.

description: one of my favorite hang outs. I typically dont venture here on the weekends as its close proximity to the broadway bridge and tunnel crowd tend to invade this landmark of a bar in North Beach. They seem to leave after realizing its not really a pick up joint. Any other night though, its the best! the 2nd floor seating with the windows to look out of are fun. The staff is always cool, and generally nice.  Very attentive service. The bathrooms are kind of odd but dont let that discourage you. Provides for some table conversation. If you do go on a saturday or friday, the turn around of customers is pretty steady and seats tend to open up every hour or so. At least thats what ive experienced. This place really takes you back in time and its just a cool spot to be for a casual night out.
author: Jesse O.

description: went here on the sunday night before mem day weekend and it was pretty packed. we sat near the window and it was the perfect spot to people watch and chat. like this bar a lot.
author: foodbot c.
